'''Love''' is a pervasive dimension of [[human]] experience that manifests itself in [[feeling]]s, [[emotion]], [[behavior]], [[thoughts]], [[perception]] and [[Attitude (psychology)|attitude]]. It influences, underlies and defines major patterns in [[interpersonal relationship]]s and [[self (psychology)|self]]-identification.
+
'''Love''' is a dimension of [[human]] experience that manifests itself in [[feeling]]s, [[emotion]], [[behavior]], [[thoughts]], [[perception]] and [[Attitude (psychology)|attitude]]. It influences, underlies and defines major patterns in [[interpersonal relationship]]s and [[self (psychology)|self]]-identification.
 
 
 
Love is variously conveyed as a sense of tender [[affection]], an intense [[interpersonal attraction|attraction]], the foundation of [[intimacy]] and good [[interpersonal chemistry]]<ref>{{cite book | last = Fisher | first = Helen | title = Why We Love – the Nature and Chemistry of Romantic Love | publisher = Henry Holt and Company | year = 2004 | id = ISBN 0-8050-6913-5}}</ref>, willing self-sacrifice on behalf of another, and as an [[ineffability|ineffable]] sense of affinity or connection to nature, other living beings, or even that which is unseen.
 
Love is variously conveyed as a sense of tender [[affection]], an intense [[interpersonal attraction|attraction]], the foundation of [[intimacy]] and good [[interpersonal chemistry]]<ref>{{cite book | last = Fisher | first = Helen | title = Why We Love – the Nature and Chemistry of Romantic Love | publisher = Henry Holt and Company | year = 2004 | id = ISBN 0-8050-6913-5}}</ref>, willing self-sacrifice on behalf of another, and as an [[ineffability|ineffable]] sense of affinity or connection to nature, other living beings, or even that which is unseen.
